text: So total random question, how many developers here are from the chicago area? and how many are a member of the Chicago HUG?
** crickets **
Crickets with guns
lol
Trying to feel out the idea of getting collabs with a developer user group being added into the normal hugs. Something Chad and I recently talked about
are you in chicago?
i'll come visit to attend one lol

I've thought about it too, just don't think too many others are around DC lol. I have been going to CodePen meetups though, and have gotten some value out of them. They're much less client-oriented (i.e. "when would you use CSS Illustration in production?" "Probably never, it's just cool"), but in terms of just keeping up with new stuff in front end, it's pretty fun.

I know the people that go to the HUG here usually come back and tell me what they talk about and it usually doesnt seem developer oriented. It'd be awesome to be able to some part of it focus on "Hey did you ever have to do XYZ? What did you use to do it?"
seems like something the director of developer relations at HubSpot should setup
I'm based out of Chicago but haven't been to a meeting.
me neither usually its our marketing/sales folks who go
trying to get a sense of how many devs go to see if we can setup part of the hug to be Dev related
Yeah I've got a few invites. I probably should take them up on the offer at some point but I have a feeling you are right.
I'd be interested if there was a future event.
i know one of the HUG co-leaders in Chicago pretty well. let me know if i can set up a warm introduction email
one of our team members here is the new co-chair or the chi hug. I'm trying to see if we can setup one over at Solemn Oath Brewery lol
Sarah Corley is one of the other co-leaders and she works here with me :slightly_smiling_face:
ah! I've not made it back to the CHI HUG with these lovely new co-leads
Well then, if Sarah and Stephanie need some extra support from HubSpot I'll do what I can internally!
Sounds good, thanks Angela!
:slightly_smiling_face:
haha sounds good to me!
